text.title: Paint a Landscape with Acrylic Paint
text.head: Paint a Landscape with Acrylic Paint
text.p: Landscape painting with acrylic paint is easy . There are 4 basic steps to any landscape Painting : Set up , Background , Detailing and Finish . This guide is meant for beginner painters and provides only the fundamental steps in Acrylic Landscape paintings . To help understand the steps and to have an example to follow , this guide will present and walkthrough an example landscape painting .
text.head: Steps
Setting Up & Materials

list.item:
Gather & Organize Materials . Before painting it is necessary to gather materials and prepare them before painting . Here are the materials used in the example painting and suggested for any landscape painting .
Canvas ( 11in x 14in )
Paint brushes ( 4in Square Painters brush , thin detailing brush , small fan brush , Medium Flat )
Water
Cups
Paper plates
Acrylic Paint ( White , Black , Red , Blue , Yellow )
Newspaper
Paper towel
Easel

Create a painting space . First find a quiet private space with minimal distractions so it is easier to paint , make sure the space has access to clean water and sufficient air flow . Lay down newspaper over the workspace to prevent unwanted paint stains .

Get ready to paint . Fill a medium cup with warm soapy water for cleaning paint brushes . Put the paints on the paper plate to mix and use . Secure canvas on the easel . Organize all the materials close for easy access while painting . Finally , decide what landscape to paint . Either find an image on the internet or in a book or have a landscape already drawn . Pick a simple landscape with more background than detail so it is easier to paint .

text.head: Starting with the Background & Blending

list.item: Prepare the canvas . First “ activate ” the canvas by brushing a small amount of regular water throughout the whole canvas preferably using the 4in painter ’s brush , this allows the paint to blend better .

Prepare the colors . Identify the main background colors of each section , for example , on the example painting :
Top- Red and Redish-Orange
Middle- Orange and Yellowish-Orange
Bottom- Black

Mix paint for background color . Mix and experiment with paint on the paper plate to create the desired color for a section of the background , use the flat medium brush to stir . It is better to have more than enough of a created color rather than have to attempt to recreate the color afterwards . Do each color one at a time for simplicity . Tips ;
Red+Yellow=Orange
Red+Blue=Purple
Yellow+Blue=Green

Paint the background . Using the medium flat brush take a “ brush full ” of the desired color and paint it onto the canvas with easy back and forth strokes . Do not paint the details or the foreground until after all the background is completed . After completing a color section , wash your brush and move onto the next section , if the next section is adjacent to another section , and you do not wish to blend the colors let the previous section dry before painting the adjacent section .
On the example painting , the top and middle sections are blended together to create a sunset but the bottom and middle section are not blended to create a horizon .

Blend colors . After painting two colors on the canvas next to each other , mix a color a shade in between the two colors on a paper plate and paint it in the area between the two colors and take the two wet color on the canvas slightly blend them together on the canvas .
Finish the background . Once the background is completely painted and there are no more “ white spaces ” on the canvas , let the canvas dry before continuing onto the detailing and foreground .

text.head: Detailing

list.item:
Work basic detailing .
Identify the depth of the painting and what aspects need to be painted first , for example in the example painting the sun must be done before the blades of grass and the horizon .
Using the small detailing brush , paint the smaller and more precise details of the foreground , Such as the rocks on the ground and the tree silhouettes and using the fan brush with a light amount of paint horizontally , softly dabbing the canvas to create leaves
Paint slowly and carefully with the thin detailing brush to create smooth lines and borders

text.head: Finishing

list.item:
Complete the painting
After all the detailing has dried , look over the painting and observe areas where the paint may need another coat because it is streaky or thin .
It may be necessary to go over small details again to fix mistakes or make the detailing cleaner .

Add your signature . After all the paint has dried and the painting looks satisfactory , autograph the canvas in the bottom right corner , using a sharpie in the negative color of the paint in the area .
Put away the materials and clean the workspace
Sell the superior painting at an auction for $ 1.37 million

text.head: Tips

list.item: The more paint , the less streaky the paint is on the canvas

text.head: Warnings

list.item: Acrylic Paint stains permanently ! Be careful wear painting appropriate clothing and use newspaper to cover the workspace
Do not leave Paint Brushes in water ! It will ruin the brushes
Make sure to put the cap on when done .
Wipe off any extra paint with a towel or tissue to avoid getting the cap stuck on the paint .
